name: Online Booking & Scheduling Calendar for WordPress by vcita
author: vCita.com

sections.description:
vcita is the #1 scheduling software for service based business. Trusted by over 100,000 users worldwide! vcita’s appointment booking and online scheduling plugin for WordPress offers a self-service scheduling software for online sessions, 1-on-1 appointments, group events and classes.

Convert website visitors to paying customers with online bookings:

  • Take online appointments requests
  • Enable online booking and rescheduling
  • Offer registration for online sessions, 1:1 appointments, classes and events
  • Register for events, sign up for classes
  • Pay for services and view their invoices / receipts
  • Offer online services via Zoom
  • Accept secure online payments

Key booking features:

  • Business calendar for you and your staff
  • Unlimited bookings and service list
  • All service types: online, 1:1 appointments, classes and events
  • Customizable services and grouping into categories
  • Customizable business hours & booking preferences
  • Business calendar for you and your staff
  • Personalized branding and online appearance
  • Email & TXT notifications, reminders & follow ups
  • Customizable booking form
  • Staff members roles and permissions management
  • Adjust to any time zone 
  • Sync with Google calendar / iCal / Outlook
  • Available in 11 languages – EN, EN GB, FR, ES, IT, PT, RU, DE, PL, NL, HE
  • Advanced analytics and export options

Who is vcita good for?
vcita was designed for service professionals and appointment-based businesses. With vcita, businesses at any size can accept bookings & payments 24/7 and manage their clients, schedule, and team from one centralized dashboard. From beauty Salons to business consultants, therapists and personal trainers, vcita fits any business, anywhere.

Why business owners love vcita?

  • Mobile app: your own office station, perfect for work on-the-go
  • Instant availability: clients can self-book and pay 24/7
  • Get paid anywhere: choose between PayPal, Square or Stripe 
  • No surprises: TXT appointment reminders eliminate no-shows 
  • Exceptional client service: safe and secure self-service portal

One app, one power house of advanced features:

  • Take bookings 24/7
  • Accept payments online, offline & on-the-go
  • Send TXT & email appointment and payment reminders 
  • Issue green invoices, receipts & price estimates
  • Keep neat client list and history records
  • Invite team members to collaborate 
  • Add lead capturing widgets to your website – Multi contact form, newsletter subscribers, booking & payment widgets
  • Offer clients a secure and professional self-service portal
  • Send email marketing campaigns and coupons

Available integrations:

  • Gmail / iCal / Outlook
  • Zoom
  • Facebook
  • Google My Business
  • Reserve with Google 
  • QuickBooks
  • Square 
  • Stripe
  • Zapier
  • PayPal

We are here 24/7/365

  • contact us
  • Join Facebook’s user community
  • Visit vcita help center

Enjoying vcita? Love us back:

  • Rate vcita 5 stars
  • Join the partners program

Follow vcita

  • Facebook
  • Linkedin
  • Instagram
  • Youtube

FREE 14 DAYS TRIAL. No credit card needed
sections.installation:
Recommended installation for Online Booking & Scheduling for WordPress by vcita

  1. Connect to WordPress admin panel
  2. Click the “Plugins” menu on the left and choose “Add New”.
  3. Search for “Online Booking & Scheduling for WordPress by vcita” and install it.
  4. After the plugin installation has finished, activate the plugin and click on the “let’s get started” button to create your account on vcita.
  5. Navigate to the “Add to Site” tab and customise your widget look and feel.
  6. Navigate to the settings tab and click on the “Start Wizard” button. Set up your scheduling preferences using vcita’s super friendly scheduling wizard.
  7. That’s it. Now Your clients can book with you.
sections.faq:
Can clients book an appointment with me outside my working hours?

When using online scheduling your clients will be able to book an appointment at any time. However, you can customize your hours of availability to your liking. By default the working days & hours are Mon-Fri 9am-5pm.

Can I sync my calendar with vcita?

Yes, vcita’s calendar enables you to sync with all other calendars such as Gmail, iCal, Outlook etc. With a click of a button your vcita calendar will be integrated to your prepared calendar. You will be able to see all the meetings that are scheduled on vcita, and most importantly avoid double bookings.

I want to use vcita’s scheduling widget just on specific pages on my site. Is it possible?

Yes. Instructions are available here

Can I use my own UI elements to open my scheduling page on vcita?

Yes. You can turn any element on your site into a smart scheduling button. Learn more here

Can I send reminders to clients?

Yes, By default your clients will get a reminder email 30 minutes before the meeting. You can change how many minutes/hours/days in advance, they will get the alert. You can also create another reminder if needed. Reminders can also be sent via sms

Is vcita HIPAA compliant?

Yes, vcita is HIPAA compliant!

Have More questions? Need assistance?

Please visit our Scheduling FAQ page to get all the answers you are looking for.

What are vcita Terms and Conditions?

Please visit Terms and Conditions

What is vcita Privacy Policy?

Please visit Privacy Policy

sections.reviews:
vCita is an excellent plug

By angelarbeasley on December 12, 2022

Very reliable, easy to setup and works well. Thanks

Awesome Website Scheduler - desktop or mobile!

By MisterJ on September 2, 2022

I have been using this plugin for years now and this is the best online scheduler I have found and I use it on any website projects that are customer service oriented. Not to mention the other features aside from scheduling - this is the best!

Sales of PR on app....its not to be used as app

By twhc01 on August 5, 2022

Sales of PR on app....its not to be used as app

Just WOW!

By kazmicshift (versilenaturals) on October 18, 2021

This site includes everything I needed for my website "All in one" I replaced 90% of my tools with vcita!! I love it!!!

No phone support!

By susanmarshallva on July 7, 2021

Customer support used to include phone support but now they seem to have eliminated this. I've been with them for years and when you need support, you usually need it quickly. Without phone support this is no longer an option.

Great Platform

By Randy E Miller (randyemiller) on February 11, 2021

Vcita is a great platform for freelancers, consultants and others who need a range of capabilities, like calendar scheduling, payment processing, online selling and the like. A great service.

Works Like a Charm

By oakleystudio on January 28, 2021

Great service, easy to configure in WordPress, works like a charm. I've only been using for a little over a month, and already had several clients use it to schedule Zoom tech support sessions with me.

Indispensabile

By donuol on January 27, 2021

Ottimo plugin

BEST Scheduling Software for developers and small business owners

By donbrown89 on August 15, 2022

LISTEN! If you need a scheduling software that can DO IT ALL, this is the one. I am a web designer, and not only do I incorporate it on my own site, I resell it to help out my web clients, while creating a passive income stream for myself. If you're a web designer, look no further than Vcita.

Description does not say subscription is needed

By earrame on October 6, 2020

I have no problem with premium plugins, nor do I have a problem with plugins that have a scaled down version and a pro version. What I do have a problem with is a company that lists the "Trial version" of their rather expensive premium plugin in the WordPress repository and does not mention in the description at all that it is a trial version and that if you want to keep the hours of work you spent setting it up, you will have to convince your client to pay a high premium. There isn't even a description of what will be left of the plugin after the trial period runs out in another week. I just have to wait and see, but I am not hopeful that I can use the plugin at all. I am extremely disappointed. I feel tricked. If there was a way to report this abuse to WordPress I certainly would.
